entry.title: Sentiment Analysis of Comment Texts Based on BiLSTM
entry.content:
# Sentiment Analysis of Comment Texts Based on BiLSTM

## Abstract

In the current sentiment analysis studies, distributed word representation is mostly used, which only considers the semantic information of word, but ignore the sentiment information of the word.

In this paper, an improved word representation method is proposed, which integrates the contribution of sentiment information into the traditional TF-IDF algorithm and generates weighted word vectors. The weighted word vectors are input into bidirectional long short term memory(BiLSTM) to capture the context information effectively.

The proposed sentiment analysis method is compared with the sentiment analysis methods of RNN, CNN, LSTM and NB.


## Introduction

The word vector has a low dimension and contains the semantic information of the word. However, distributed word vectors do not contain sentiment information about words.

In this paper, the contribution of the wordâ€™s sentiment information to text sentiment classiï¬cation is embedded into the traditional TF-IDF algorithm, and the weighted word vector is generated.


## Background

### Text Sentiment Analysis Technology

Text sentiment analysis can be divided into:

  • According to the object of sentiment analysis

    • three levels: words,sentences,chapters.

  • According to the classifictaion method of sentiment orientation

    • binary sentiment classification,ternary sentiment classification and multi-sentiment classification.

  • According to the text sentiment analysis methods

    • sentiment analysis method based on sentiment dictionary,machine learning and deep learning.

Method based on sentiment dictionary uses the dictionary to identify sentiment words in the text and obtain sentiment values.

Then according to the sentiment calculation rules, the text sentiment tendency is obtained.

Text sentiment analysis based on sentiment dictionary does not require manual labeling of samples and is easy to implement.

The quality of the analysis is highly dependent on the sentiment dictionary. Most of the sentiment dictionaries have problems such as insufficient coverage of sentiment words and lack of domain words.


The earliest research on text sentiment analysis based on machine learning used naive Bayesian algorithm,maximum entropy alogorithm and SVM algorithm.

Goldberg - A graph-based semi-supervised classification algorithm.

Wang - A high-dimensional mixed feature sentiment analysis model based on SVM.

Sentiment analysis mthod based on machine learning tends to be more accurate, but it relies on the quality of the corpus labeled wityh polarity. <ä¾èµ–äºè¯­æ–™åº“çš„ææ€§æ ‡è®°è´¨é‡>


Deep learning into sentiment analysis.

  • RNTN - a sentiment tree library, which synthesized semantics on the syntactic tree of binary sentiment polarity.

  • CharSCNN - used two convolutional layers to extract the features of related words and sentences, and mined semantic information.

  • RNN - used the Recurrent Neural Network based on time series information to obtain sentence representation.

  • Tree-Structure Long Short-Term Memory Network Model.

  • Attention mechanism into the LSTM.


Considering that the feature words of comments are sparse, and in order to better capture the context information, BiLSTM in deep learning is used to obtain the comment representation in this paper.


### Word Representation

Sentiment Analysis using Deep Learning â€“ A survey

Abstract

In this paper, they are going to

  • perform multi-class sentiment analysis using Deep learning models like LSTM and C-LSTM on textual data
  • see its results as compared to other Machine learning models
  • carry out parameter tuning using Dropout regularization to analyze its effect on the accuracy of the model

Introduction

In this paper, they are going to perform a multi-class sentiment analysis using Deep Learning on amazon product review data.

Related Work

Three techniques for Sentiment Analysis: Lexicon based,Machine Learning and Deep Learning.

Machine Learning

  • Supervised Learning
    • Classification
    • Regression
  • Unsupervised Learning
    • Clustering

With the increase in the amount of diversified(å¤šæ ·åŒ–çš„) data to be processed, Machine Learning cannot cope up with the performance. Hence, Deep Learning came into the picture.

Deep Learning

  • Convolution Neural Network(CNN)
  • Recurrent Neural Network(RNN)
  • Long Short Term Memory(LSTM)
  • â€¦

In this paper, they are incorporating(åˆå¹¶) the Word2Vec using the CBOW(Common Bag-of-words) embedding model.

Proposed Methodology

Dataset Description

The file is in a CSV format consisting of 6,50,000 reviews and ratings. Each review has a rating that is in the range from 1 to 5.

One-hot-encoding

The data in the rating column is label encoded which may confuse the model while training, hence it is one-hot-encoded.

Preprocessing and Tokenization

preprocessing: converting the text in lower-case,eliminating punctuation,numbers,special characters and stop words

Tokenization: break the text into tokens.

E.g:

[[â€˜modelâ€™,â€™mayâ€™,â€™okâ€™,â€™sedentaryâ€™,â€™typesâ€™ ,â€™activeâ€™,â€™getâ€™,â€™aroundâ€™,â€™alotâ€™,â€™jobâ€™,â€™c onsistentlyâ€™,â€™foundâ€™,â€™stockingsâ€™,â€™rolled â€˜,â€™anklesâ€™,â€™goodâ€™,â€™solutionâ€™,â€™goâ€™,â€™stand ardâ€™,â€™compressionâ€™,â€™stockingâ€™,â€™stockâ€™,â€™e xcellentâ€™,â€™supportâ€™,â€™staysâ€™,â€™givesâ€™,â€™nee dâ€™,â€™pairâ€™,â€™alsoâ€™,â€™toreâ€™,â€™struggledâ€™,â€™pul lâ€™,â€™timeâ€™,â€™goodâ€™,â€™riddancebadâ€™,â€™investme ntâ€™]]

Word Embedding

A process of converting the word representations to vectors. (Word2Vec model and GloVe model)

æœ¬æ–‡ä½¿ç”¨çš„æ˜¯Word2Vec using the Continuous Bag of Words(CBOW) model.

Padding and Splitting

The length of the reviews is not the same. So they keep the length of the text sequence equal by padding zeros at the end(post-padding) or at the beginning(pre-padding).

Data: 80%-training set | 20%-validation set

Recurrent Neural Network(RNN)

RNN has memory. The major drawback of RNN is the Vanishing gradient problem.

(â€œhalf part of the network which is closer to the output is updatedâ€ and â€œanother half part away from the output is not updated properlyâ€)

Long Short Term Memory(LSTM)

To overcome the vanishing gradient problem of RNN, Long Short Term Memory(LSTM) is implemented.

This paper uses CuDNNLSTM model which uses a Deep Neural network using CUDA.

CuDNN library aids in fast processing with the help of parallel processing GPU.

The model is compiled using Adam optimizer having categorical cross-entropy as the value of the loss gradient.

C-LSTM

The advange of CNN to determine local features and that of LSTM to interpret the sequential information can be combined in the C-LSTM model.

Experiments And Results

Changing the dataset

Dataset 1: A Yelp data set consisting of 6,40,000 reviews and having columns reviews and ratings. Each Rating category in this data set has 1,30,00 reviews.

Dataset 2: Amazon Home & Appliances containing 5,51682 reviews and ratings.

Dataset 3: Amazon general product reviews consisting of 6,50,000 reviews and ratings. Each review has a rating that is in the range from 1 to 5.

C-LSTM Model

Machine Learning models

LSTM and C-LSTM in Comparison with machine learning algorithms like SVM and Baive Bayes.

Increasing the number of epochs may lead to overfitting. Hence dropout regularization is used to overcome the problem of overfitting.

entry.content:
Abstract

In this paper, they are going:

  • to survey different steps and techniques on sentiment analysis.
  • to find out a better way to increase the accuracy and efficiency of a model.
  • to discuss various challenges in sentiment analysis.

Introduction

Reviews helps the potential user to understand the product from inside out.

Finding the suitable techniques to analyse the reviews is the main objective of this paper.

Sentiment analysis can be carried out by two approaches i.e. machine learning approach and lexicon based approach.

Data Acquisition

Use a web scraper beautiful soup to extract the reviews from webpages.

Data Preprocessing

The extracted reviews of a product are in the form of either sentences or paragraphs.

Basically data preprocessing include tokenization, stop-words removal, stemming(è¯å¹²æå–) and lemmatization(è¯å…ƒåŒ–).

Tokenization

Dividing the paragraphs into sentences and sentences into words.

Word tokenizer: tokenize the sentence into words.

sentence tokenizer: tokenize the paragraph into sentences.

Stop-words Removal

Stop-words are words that are not considered or do not contribute in the analysis process. (better to remove rather than storing)

Stemming and Lemmatization

Steamming is the process of finding out morphemes(è¯ç´ ) or the root words from the derived words. (not give the actual morphemes but the closest one)

  • morphemes: In English grammar and morphology, a morpheme is a meaningful linguistic unit consisting of a word such as dog, or a word element, such as the -s at the end of dogs, that canâ€™t be divided into smaller meaningful parts. Morphemes are the smallest units of meaning in a language

Lemmatization gives the actual root word by comparing the stemmed words in its dictionary and gives the closest actual one.

Analyzed Output

reviews -> (preprocessing step) -> tokens -> (various algorithms) -> output in the form of rating

Sentiment Classification Techniques

Lexicon based approach, Machine learning approach and Hybrid approach are the classification of Sentiment Analysis.

Lexicon based approach

Lexicon based approach divides the entire document into lexemes(è¯ç´ ) which is used to examine the sentences.
